meanings.definition: A person or thing that makes something cheaper in quality or value.
meanings.sent1: The store's constant use of cheapeners led to a decline in product quality.
meanings.sent2: The cheapeners in the manufacturing process resulted in a less durable final product.
meanings.sent3: The cheapeners in the form of shortcuts taken by the company made the customers wary.
meanings.sent4: The cheapeners acted like little elves, diminishing the worth of the items they touched.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the cheapeners lurking in the shadows, ready to devalue your purchases.

meanings.definition: To make something cheaper in quality or value.
meanings.sent1: The company decided to cheapen their products by using inferior materials.
meanings.sent2: She didn't want to cheapen the brand by offering discounts on premium items.
meanings.sent3: The magician's attempt to cheapen the value of gold coins turned them into chocolate.
meanings.sent4: His constant criticism only served to cheapen the efforts of the hardworking team.
meanings.sent5: The artist refused to cheapen her art by mass-producing it for quick profits.
